Jake Standish


Technology Strategist

ASCD 69th Annual Conference & Exhibit Show

March 15–17, 2014, Los Angeles, California 		Teaching Digital Citizenship: Design Curriculum for Teachers and Students

Digital citizenship is a broad term, and educators search for strategies to guide students on how to use technology appropriately. There are many elements of digital citizenship, such as digital rights, digital responsibilities, digital law, and digital etiquette. This session will demonstrate how participants can develop their own digital citizenship curriculum. The presenters’ goal is to share their district’s journey in the design of digitally engaging and secure learning environments.

NCTIES

March 5-7, 2014, Raleigh, North Carolina 		Learn, Teach, CODE!

In this session we will explain and demonstrate coding has become the new literacy. We will show how adults can learn to code, but more importantly how you can get your students to want to code using fun web sites and iOS/Android apps.

Digesting Digital Citizenship

Digital citizenship is a broad term, and educators search for strategies to guide students on how to use technology appropriately. There are many elements of digital citizenship, such as digital rights, digital responsibilities, digital law, and digital etiquette. This session will demonstrate how participants can develop their own digital citizenship curriculum. The presenters goal is to share their district’s journey in the design of digitally engaging and secure learning environments.

Edulum’s First Annual Teaching Conference

August 2013, Charlotte, North Carolina 		Inspiring Instruction With iTunes U

Now it’s easier than ever to unleash the full potential of iPad in your classroom by creating your own courses for iPad. You get to share your ideas in a powerful new way, and your students get a rich, immersive learning experience using the iTunes U app for iPad. iTunes U is available no matter where you teach —at any college, university, or K-12 school. Teachers will get an overview of Apple’s iTunesU courses and will begin to create their own course for students to access course information and complete assignments at anytime.

Every Student Can Learn Code!

An emphasis on computational learning and programming skills is gaining ground in all subjects and grade levels. You will explore resources to help you and your students learn programming skills form the fundamentals to the advanced. You will also discover how you can use these new skills for developing your own websites and apps!

Lake Norman Instructional Technology Conference

June 2013, Lake Norman, North Carolina 		20 Tools for Commuication

In this session, we will show you how to incorporate free and convenient tools that will allow you to communicate better than ever before and require less time doing it!

TLC At The Beach 2013

March 2013, Myrtle Beach, South Carolina 		Connecting Common Core with Safari and iBooks

Come join us in using digital literacy in the 21st Century classroom using an iPad. We will explore reading strategies and best practices using Safari and iBooks while connecting it with the Common Core Standards. Discover how to differentiate reading levels, build vocabulary and support arguments using highlights, notes, and bookmarks. Learn how to publish your own iBooks tailored to your student’s needs and even share student writing in the iBooks app. You will walk away knowing how to help your students be college and career ready individuals through using digital technology and Common Core Standards.

NCTIES 2013

March 2013, Raleigh, North Carolina 		Creating Content: Podcasting, Vodcasting, iTunes & U

Imagine creating content that your students and teachers can receive in iTunes, from your class wiki, websites, or LMS? You can create a 21st Century opportunity of teaching, learning, and engaging this generation through the tools and methods that are most impactful. Learn how to create a weekly video and audio podcast that is aggregated into iTunes (and able to embed on any website) so you, your teachers, your students and their parents can be engaged and interact with content anywhere.


i4T-Innovation for Transformation

Learn how a large urban school district with over 150 schools, 140,000 students, and 18,000 teachers, support staff and administrators transform the way educators think about technology integration by pairing a coaching application, an innovative technology tool and a district-wide collaborative effort to introduce administrative staff to a new way of thinking about technology and technology integration.

FETC 2013

January 2013, Orlando, Florida 		Creating Content: Podcasting, Vodcasting, iTunes & U

Imagine creating content that your students and teachers can receive in iTunes, from your class wiki, websites, or LMS? You can create a 21st Century opportunity of teaching, learning, and engaging this generation through the tools and methods that are most impactful. Learn how to create a weekly video and audio podcast that is aggregated into iTunes (and able to embed on any website) so you, your teachers, your students and their parents can be engaged and interact with content anywhere.

NCTIES 2012

March 2012 		Yammer:The Educator's Social Network

The most important aspect of a Professional Learning Network (PLN) is having the infrastructure and social networking tools to communicate, collaborate, and share resources. In a large school district like Charlotte Mecklenburg Schools, Yammer has been used to create communities of like-minded teachers across the district and engage them in teaching, learning, and creating in a digital world. In this presentation we will have a panel of educators to discuss how educators and administrators have utilized an enterprise social network (Yammer.com) to discuss all aspects of their profession.

NCTIES 2011

March 2011 		QR codes and why they matter to education. (CREATE - COLLABORATE - COMMUNICATE)

Use these free to create physical links to the virtual world to engage, empower, and excite students while they acquire, analyze, and synthesize content. Attendees are encouraged to bring their own camera enabled smartphone or laptop to explore the technology themselves in the session.
